AbstractClassWithoutAbstractMethod.description:
Description

The abstract class does not contain any abstract methods. An abstract class suggests
an incomplete implementation, which is to be completed by subclasses implementing the
abstract methods. If the class is intended to be used as a base class only (not to be instantiated
directly) a protected constructor can be provided to prevent direct instantiation.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
AbstractClassWithoutAbstractMethod.option: This rule has no specific options.
